(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

nodes.body:
LGTM

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Thanks for doing this! Once it is in, I'll use it to golf a bit in #11712 as you suggested.
(Or in a follow-up PR if this here takes longer...)

This seems reasonable to me, and I'm not convinced that going to `SignType` will make things (significantly) nicer.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8526196976/job/23354919715)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8526196976/job/23354918884)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8526196976/job/23354919436)
To me this looks like an argument to change the return type to be `SignType`
Wouldn't this just add yet another layer of coercions that you have to translate everything through whenever you want to do arithmetic with `Î¼`?
To push this further, I guess one could argue that `ArithmeticFunction.zeta` should take values in `Fin 2`...
I suspect that the coercions aren't really a problem; and in exchange, you get results like this and the `abs` one for free
(if the coercions were really that bad, then presumably `SignType` wouldn't exist at all!)

I'm afraid the coercions really are that bad, and that's why `SignType` is barely used at all in the library. I had a reviewer insist on me using `SignType` in a PR recently and it was very painful indeed.
Could you link to that review?
#10883. See also #10920, which was some API additions for `SignType` which I had to add to get #10883 working.

FWIW, I just had a stab at reimplementing `Î¼` to be `SignType`-valued, just to check how bad it would be. It's every bit as bad as I expected. Literally every single lemma in the library about `Î¼` would need to be rewritten, with clunkier statements and longer proofs. We'd also need to add a whole load of tedious boilerplate code about coercions `ArithmeticFunction SignType â†’ ArithmeticFunction R` for appropriate `R`, and compatibility of these with morphisms between `R`'s. This is really, really not the way to go.
Thanks for the cross-links. I'll have a think about this some more later, but actually changing this probably isn't a blocker for this PR (I'll let another maintainer decide).

> FWIW, I just had a stab at reimplementing `Î¼` to be `SignType`-valued, just to check how bad it would be

Would you mind sharing the branch with this stab on? No need to PR it, but if you put in the work it's nice to refer back to if this comes up again in future.
I deleted it, sorry.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: small lemmas about moebius
